page.title: 07Thurnham
page.content: Part-time licensed fishermen catch salmon and sea trout with Whammel nets or with draw nets which need three men working together (1 tows out, 2 hold net then it is drawn in in a semicircle trapping the fish) or by standing in the river with a haaf net on a beam. Fewer licenses are granted and catches are reduced. Fish are sold fresh in Lancaster or smoked at Glasson Dock. A few shrimp boats fish in Morecambe Bay. Plaice and Mullet are caught with rod and line. Cockles and periwinkles found on the shore are unfit for human consumption.
